column4: I've noticed that other ra2800usb devices seem to have a dmesg line about requesting firmware, while this one doesn't
is it not provided by the linux-firmware package
that's not my point.  I've installed all of the firmware, but I have no way to determine if any of it is actually being used.
it doens't claim that it failed to find firmware, or sucessfully loaded it
dmesg should say what firmware was used
it should, shouldn't it.
should is a wonderful word.  sudo lshw -C network    will show some firmware info
and that one does.  but dmesg never reported it.
does:  sudo iwlist scan   show SSIDs?
nope, "no results found"
if you unload and reload the module in terminal, does it give any interesting output?
is it usb based?
are there bugs reported?
it is usb based
could go to ralink's page and compile the driver if code is available
I've attempted that for the rt2870sta module.  I'm not convinced that the kernel people know what the device is.  its listed as rt2800 unknown
its a usb thing, they are cheap
try get a broadcom based one or intel
what video chip do you use?
nvidia gt260M
try the boot option: nouveau.blacklist=1
is that a grub option?
yes
